data.title: Ukraine grain export deal back on track as Russia resumes participation
data.description: ANKARA/KYIV — Russia said on Wednesday it would resume its participation in a deal freeing up grain exports from war-torn Ukraine, reversing a move that world leaders had said threatened to exacerbate global hunger. Moscow announced the sudden reversal after Turkey and the United Nations helped keep Ukrainian grain flowing for several days without a […]

data.title: U.S. wheat slumps as Russia says it will resume Black Sea grain deal
data.description: PARIS/CHICAGO — Wheat futures plummeted from Chicago to Europe on Wednesday after Russia said it would resume its participation in a deal to export grain from war-torn Ukraine, a reversal of its weekend decision to pull out of the deal in a move that had sent wheat futures surging higher. Corn followed wheat lower on […]

data.title: U.S. weekly jobless claims fall; layoffs pick up in October
data.description: WASHINGTON — The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits unexpectedly fell last week, suggesting the labor market remains strong despite slowing domestic demand amid stiff interest rate hikes from the Federal Reserve to tame inflation. Initial claims for state unemployment benefits slipped 1,000 to a seasonally adjusted 217,000 for the week ended […]

data.author: Bloomberg News
data.title: Earnings Season Nears Close as Economy Darkens: The London Rush
data.description: This morning’s edition takes a look ahead to the companies reporting next week, the last really busy week of the year. We’ll also likely hear more about Rishi Sunak and Jeremy Hunt’s plans for the Autumn Statement. Bloomberg reported yesterday that they’re  considering cutting the tax-free allowance for dividend income. The challenge ahead was all underscored yesterday by the Bank of England’s sobering economic forecast.
